title: WWE's IIconics want to star in Neighbours but Aussie stars have never seen it
text:
Illonics fancy starring in Neighbours (Picture: WWE)

The IIconics would join iconic show Neighbours for the 25th anniversary celebrations but admit they’ve never seen an episode.

Australian WWE duo Peyton Royce and Billie Kay – who became only the second women’s tag team champions when they defeated Bayley and Sasha Banks for the titles at WrestleMania 35 in April – admitted they haven’t actually watched the hugely popular soap despite being from Down Under, but they would be up for a cameo role next year.

Peyton told the Metro.co.uk: ‘We never really watched it, does it still run?! 25 years?! Wow! I mean, I’d love to be on an episode. I have to be honest, I haven’t seen an episode but that’s because I was so involved with being a dancer and chasing my dream of becoming a wrestler, I just didn’t watch TV. So, I missed out on the Australian thing.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

The pair – who met at high school and eventually bonded over their love for professional wrestling – admitted they would love to follow Billie’s idol Dwayne ‘The Rock’ Johnson into acting one day, but their real goal is to just ‘entertain’.

‘We just wanna be in the entertainment industry, we want to stay in that field,’ she said.

‘At the end of the day, we just want to entertain people. Wherever that takes us in the future,we’re excited and intrigued to pursue that wherever it takes us!’

Illonics (Picture: WWE)

However, the team’s real passion and ambitions lie in the world of wrestling – even after an incredible year which saw them realise their dreams with the huge WrestleMania moment.

Peyton added: ‘First of all, being in the match at WrestleMania was bucket list for us! That was our first opportunity, and to be on the show and win the tag team titles at WrestleMania. You can see how much that meant to us.

‘We got so much love from people reaching out to us from colleagues to friends and family, to fans, recognising how important that moment was to us and what it really meant. All that emotion afterwards was 15 years of us grinding for that one moment. That’s gonna be something that we cherish forever.’

That’s not all for the BFFs though, who conceded at this point that any other highlights are a bonus. So what’s left?

‘It’s a funny question,’ Peyton said. ‘We’ve ticked off so many of our goals so quickly. Anything else is just a cherry on top! One of our goals is obviously to be inducted into the Hall of Fame, when the time comes – if there’s room!’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Peyton and Billie in the Hall of Fame? That really would be IIconic!

*Friday Night SmackDown airs every week at 1am on Sky Sports Arena and Main Event. WWE will be touring the UK next month with a huge double TV taping featuring both Raw and SmackDown superstars in Manchester on 8 November.
description: The wrestlers were too busy chasing dreams than watching TV.
